metadata.dc:author: Cortina, Héctor
Cifrián, Carlos
Cano, Bernardo
Insa, Sonia
Hernández, Miguel
metadata.dc:description: Gorham-Stout syndrome, also called "disappearing bone disease" or idiopathic massive osteolysis, is a rare disease of unknown etiology and pathogenesis. It is characterized by rapidly progressive localized massive osteolysis associated to a proliferation of vascular structures of benign origin in which the absence of new bone formation is representative. We present two cases (a six-year-old boy with affected right ulna, and a 15-year-old girl with right rib affection associated to chylothorax) of this disease with the characteristic clinical, histological, and imaging findings.
metadata.dc:title: Hallazgos radiológicos del síndrome de Gorham-Stout.
[Radiologic findings in Gorham-Stout syndrome].
